Articles.Content:
![Q5E1jsJ.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/Q5E1jsJ.jpg)

**Cira VIII**

**Designer: Zekes**

**Status:****COMPLETED**

**Cost:** **$2,069,299.00**

**Do you need to put 1000 tons into LKO RIGHT NOW? Then this is your rocket! Guaranteed to be 99% reliable. Simply fly as a normal rocket, and stage when engines run out. Warranty voided if fairings collapse, they can't seem to take the weight of 1000 tons too well.**

***Download: https://www.mediafire.com/?5afof3ekuf3bpb1***

**Edited <time datetime="2016-03-26T21:17:39Z" title="03/26/2016 09:17  PM" data-short="8 yr">March 26, 2016</time> by zekes**
Part count?
526 parts.

> 
> 526 parts.

Uh oh.

Great build! 

I like it!
It's not that bad - 1/2 a part per ton.

How much fuel is 1000 tons? ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

And my God, two million funds? That's more that the combined worth of my entire Hard mode space center! ![:0.0:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_shocked.gif)

(Speaking of which, now that I upgraded to 1.0.2, I'm not gonna do Hard mode anymore. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) Still too slow... at least, until I'm used to the new mechanics)

> 
> How much fuel is 1000 tons? ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)
> And my God, two million funds? That's more that the combined worth of my entire Hard mode space center! ![:0.0:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_shocked.gif)
> 
> (Speaking of which, now that I upgraded to 1.0.2, I'm not gonna do Hard mode anymore. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) Still too slow... at least, until I'm used to the new mechanics)

It's over 1,200,000L of LF+O, and puts out over 1 million Newtons of thrust.

![9yLOf8E.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/9yLOf8E.jpg)

I see you've surrounded it with a salt circle to keep the Kraken away.... ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

The clipping, the clipping is real.

> 
> I see you've surrounded it with a salt circle to keep the Kraken away.... ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
> The clipping, the clipping is real.

the clipping is indeed real... but that's how I make the 2nd stage, by tradition. I could spread it out but I think it might look weird...

> 
> the clipping is indeed real... but that's how I make the 2nd stage, by tradition. I could spread it out but I think it might look weird...

Riiiight. That clears up a few things. I actually feel better for having failed my first 1000t to LKO experiment. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

 Still must of been a challenge to make, still a great build.
If anything part clipping makes it even harder to keep from blowing up...
At least the fairing isnt bigger than the rocket itself anymore. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
I am in love with this.

Haha damn it cost as much as my entire refueling station ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif).... I wonder if it could lift my refueling stations rocket into orbit... this must be tested, pretty sure it weighs more than the 1000 tons though... that might be a problem, might need to cut it in half. still. 

![jevsQNl.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/jevsQNl.jpg)

Idk how im going to go about trying to put this rocket on top of your rocket, it has no core hmm.

- - - Updated - - -

I thinks its too heavy. 

ill try again firing both rockets, brilliance.

![RjOC5qC.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/RjOC5qC.jpg)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-11T05:02:32Z" title="05/11/2015 05:02  AM" data-short="9 yr">May 11, 2015</time> by Roflcopterkklol**
Moar boosters!

> 
> Moar boosters!

Believe it or not your rockets in there somewhere lol, at like 1 frame every 20 seconds here, im not even above 1km as i type this lol, not going to try and orbit just going to send it into deep space

![RdwRHlM.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/RdwRHlM.jpg)

Mein Gott that must weigh 10,000 tons....

> 
> Mein Gott that must weigh 10,000 tons....

something close to that its at 1400ish parts lol, nearly a million oxidizer on launch

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-11T05:52:57Z" title="05/11/2015 05:52  AM" data-short="9 yr">May 11, 2015</time> by Roflcopterkklol**

> 
> something close to that its at 1400ish parts lol

Mein Gott. That's as bad as my Shuttle (which is dead now, it's more drag than a parasol)

> 
> Mein Gott. That's as bad as my Shuttle (which is dead now, it's more drag than a parasol)

Honestly its the biggest thing i have ever launched lol, up to 3km wew, and only like 20 explosions so far.. oh god im going to have to start staging the rockets soon

![M8NBiCo.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/M8NBiCo.jpg)
Jeez is that the Cira VIII below it still attached?

i knew staging would cause problems lol, idk why it dislodged the side boosters that ruined everything haha 

![jkjj5Pr.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/jkjj5Pr.jpg)

![kuzIg4J.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/kuzIg4J.jpg)

And yes, yes it is still going, lol you want the craft file maybe? 

![MohzVPe.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/MohzVPe.jpg)

- - - Updated - - -

Disaster struck in the form of the launch clamps, they came at about mach 5 and destroyed the rocket lmao, i still cant believe what happened, they appeared from no where with such aggression 

![0yga84Z.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/0yga84Z.jpg)

Wow... the explosion... debris is still hitting the ground lol.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-11T06:10:59Z" title="05/11/2015 06:10  AM" data-short="9 yr">May 11, 2015</time> by Roflcopterkklol**

For the launch clamps, i encountered that problem with my Chaos star mk2 - basically, if one of the launch clamps is hanging in the air (and not resting on the launch pad) it 'appears' next to your flying rocket from time to time (at least, until you discarded the boosters they were attached to) - which can be pretty dangerous ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Now that i try to keep all those clamps on the launch pad, i don't see the bug anymore ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

(Though, the clamps are still wobblier than before ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif))

> 
> For the launch clamps, i encountered that problem with my Chaos star mk2 - basically, if one of the launch clamps is hanging in the air (and not resting on the launch pad) it 'appears' next to your flying rocket from time to time (at least, until you discarded the boosters they were attached to) - which can be pretty dangerous ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)
> Now that i try to keep all those clamps on the launch pad, i don't see the bug anymore ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
> 
> (Though, the clamps are still wobblier than before ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif))

Interesting, idk if you could get away with removing them being such a tall and top heavy rocket, i mean its taller and as wide as the VAB at the top
